headline: Citigroup (C) Appoints New Head Of AI To Expand AI Implementation
summary: Citigroup (C) recently made headlines with the appointment of Shobhit Varshney as the new head of AI, signaling an increased focus on advanced technology integration. Over the past quarter, Citigroup's price moved up 24%, as the broader market also experienced an uptrend driven by expectations of a Federal Reserve rate cut, with major indices reaching record highs. Varshney's appointment, alongside strong Q2 earnings and increased dividends, supported positive sentiment around Citigroup. The...

headline: Truist Raises Citigroup (C) PT to $105, Cites Strong Q2 2025 Performance
summary: Citigroup Inc. (NYSE:C) is one of the best inexpensive stocks to buy according to hedge funds. On September 3, Truist analyst John McDonald raised the firm’s price target on Citi to $105 from $99, while keeping a Buy rating on the shares. headline: Is It Worth Investing in Citigroup (C) Based on Wall Street's Bullish Views?
summary: Based on the average brokerage recommendation (ABR), Citigroup (C) should be added to one's portfolio. Wall Street analysts' overly optimistic recommendations cast doubt on the effectiveness of this highly sought-after metric. So, is the stock worth buying?

headline: Citi CEO Sees Pickup in Dealmaking With Recession Unlikely
summary: Clients have become “much more active” in capital markets, investing and dealmaking after greater clarity on taxes, tariffs and deregulation, Jane Fraser told Bloomberg TV in an interview.  That’s been good news for the markets businesses at Citigroup and its Wall Street rivals as they benefited from a surge in client activity.

raw.headline: Citi CEO Sees Pickup in Dealmaking With Recession Unlikely

headline: This Dividend Stock Has More Than Doubled in 2 Years. Is There More Gas Left in the Tank?
summary: Citigroup stock has more than doubled over the last 2 years as markets give a thumbs-up to its turnaround. It has a healthy dividend yield of 2.5% and should continue outperforming large-cap banking peers over the medium term.
